radiographic_examinations.findings: Right temporal mass with surrounding mild edema.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Twelve months later, a follow-up MRI showed recurrence of the mass; 21 months after the second surgery, MRI showed a third recurrence of the mass.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Indicated reduced blood flow compatible with a low-grade glioma.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The tumor appeared dark, signifying reduced blood flow compared with surrounding cortex and white matter.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Choline/creatinine ratio elevated, indicating a more malignant phenotype before the third resection.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Choline/creatinine ratio normalized after the third resection.
